subject: Re: Can anyone help me see how to usefully work with JUnit in a big project, please?
msgSnippet: Hi again, Joakim ... so ... Yes, that does sound familiar! ... navigate. ... Do ... Interesting - another pointer to places where we re putting too much in one
messageBody:
Hi again, Joakim

> It depends on what your strategy is. I'd advice against "navigating"
> with mocks (in order to test this branch mockA.someFlag() needs to
> return 4711 and then it will go through this loop two times before
so
> mockA.hasNext() must return true twice and then false. After that we
> setup expectations on MockB and those are the ones we /really/ care
> about).
Yes, that does sound familiar!

> Basically, if you are /navigating/ to something that you care about.
> See if you can structure your code so that you don't have to
navigate.
> Can you extract that chunk of logic to a separate method or class.
Do
> you lack an abstraction?
Interesting - another pointer to places where we're putting too much
in one place. OK, that's interesting - sounds as if everything's
pointing towards that as the major issue...


Thanks for the info, and for the link too - something else I'll take
a peek at!

Thanks again,
Tracey
